channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A Wallace semigroup whose every finite power is countably compact
item.description: arXiv:2403.00205v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that, assuming the existence of $\mathfrak{c}$ incomparable selective ultrafilters, there exists a Wallace semigroup whose infinite countable power is the least power which fails to be countably compact. This answers positively Question 9.4 of \cite{Tomita15}.
item.dc:creator: Juan Luis Jaisu\~no Fuentes-Magui\~na, Vinicius de Oliveira Rodrigues, Artur Hideyuki Tomita

item.title: On $\delta\mathbb{P}$-approximation Spaces
item.description: arXiv:2403.00654v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In order to deal with imprecision, ambiguity, and uncertainty in data analysis, Pawlak introduced rough set theory in 1982. This paper aims to expand the scope of basic set theory developed by presenting the notions of $\delta\mathbb{P}$-upper and $\delta\mathbb{P}$-lower approximations, that are based on the notion of $\delta\mathbb{P}$-open sets, we additionally examine a few of their fundamental characteristics.
item.dc:creator: Huda Mohsin, Faik Mayah
